1.description: A pale, sickly mapmaker in the First Army. Small and weak, often overlooked. Best friends with Mal Oretsev since childhood at Keramzin orphanage.

2.description: Discovers she can summon light when Mal is attacked by volcra in the Shadow Fold. Her power manifests as blinding light that drives away the creatures.

4.description: Brought to the Little Palace and given luxurious quarters. Struggles to control her power and feels overwhelmed by her new status.

1.description: A skilled tracker in the First Army. Handsome and popular with other soldiers. Has been Alina's best friend since childhood at Keramzin orphanage.

2.description: Nearly killed by volcra in the Shadow Fold when their skiff is attacked. His injuries trigger Alina's power to manifest for the first time.
A powerful Grisha who can summon and control darkness. Commands great respect and fear. Appears young but his eyes suggest great age.

3.description: Leader of all Grisha in Ravka. Wears a black kefta and travels with an elite guard. Shows particular interest in Alina's power.

4.description: Brings Alina to the Little Palace, his stronghold. Claims her power could destroy the Shadow Fold that plagues Ravka.
A beautiful Grisha Corporalnik who can alter appearances. Has distinctive red hair and wears a white kefta instead of the traditional red.

5.description: Uses her Tailoring abilities to improve Alina's appearance. Explains the hierarchy and politics of the Little Palace.
An ancient, bitter Grisha woman who teaches at the Little Palace. Has white hair and a sharp tongue. Extremely powerful but uses her abilities sparingly.

6.description: Harshly trains Alina to control her power. Shows little patience for weakness or self-pity.

3.description: A powerful Heartrender in the Darkling's personal guard. Wears a red kefta and has a stern, intimidating presence.
A cheerful Heartrender who serves as one of the Darkling's guards. More approachable than Ivan but equally dangerous.

1.description: A fellow cartographer in the First Army unit with Alina. Part of the surveying team crossing the Shadow Fold.
A fellow cartographer in the First Army unit with Alina. Part of the surveying team crossing the Shadow Fold.

8.description: The weak and ineffectual ruler of Ravka. Overshadowed by his court and increasingly dependent on the Darkling's power.
The vain and shallow queen who is obsessed with her appearance. Completely dependent on Genya's Tailoring abilities.

4.description: A young Grisha Squaller who befriends Alina at the Little Palace. Wears a blue kefta and has a cheerful disposition.
A Grisha Squaller and Marie's best friend. Also wears a blue kefta and is kind to Alina when she arrives.
A beautiful and powerful Squaller who immediately dislikes Alina. Has dark hair and wears a blue kefta. Arrogant and competitive.

5.description: Reveals her jealousy of the attention Alina receives. Makes Alina's life difficult at the Little Palace through petty cruelties.

12.description: A charismatic privateer captain who rescues Alina and Mal from the sea. Has a roguish charm and commands a flying ship.
A giant Shu Heartrender who serves as Sturmhond's first mate. Has a love of poetry and is surprisingly gentle despite his size.
A skilled Shu warrior and Heartrender who is part of Sturmhond's crew. Tolya's twin sister, equally dangerous but more direct.

4.description: A nervous young Grisha Heartrender at the Little Palace. Easily frightened and not particularly powerful.

1.description: The stern headmistress of Keramzin orphanage where Alina and Mal grew up. Strict but caring in her own way.

5.description: A former mercenary who teaches combat at the Little Palace. Speaks with a thick accent and is an excellent weapons instructor.

8.description: The King's spiritual advisor, a gaunt priest with ambitious eyes. Sees opportunity in Alina's power for religious purposes.

relationships.Alina Starkov: Seeks to use for religious purposes

5.description: A brilliant but socially awkward Durast who creates Grisha amplifiers and devices. Wears a purple kefta and is completely absorbed in his work.

2.description: Terrifying winged creatures that live in the Shadow Fold. Attack anything that enters their domain with razor-sharp claws and teeth.

4.description: Grisha who work with materials - Durasts work with solid materials like metal and stone, while Alkemis work with chemicals and poisons.

relationships.David: Most notable member at Little Palace

1.description: Regular human soldiers who make up the bulk of Ravka's military forces. Often resentful of the Grisha Second Army's privileges.

10.description: A legendary Grisha who created powerful amplifiers from mythical creatures. Disappeared long ago but his work remains.

11.description: A magical white stag that serves as one of Morozova's amplifiers. Grants incredible power to whoever claims it.

8.description: The head of the royal guard at the Grand Palace. Responsible for the King and Queen's security.

1.description: Enemy soldiers from Shu Han who are at war with Ravka. Known for their discipline and cruelty toward captured Grisha.
Enemy soldiers from Fjerda who hunt and kill Grisha, believing them to be abominations. Particularly feared by all Grisha.
Common people of Ravka who suffer under the constant warfare and the Shadow Fold's disruption of trade routes.

4.description: The many servants who work at the Little Palace and Grand Palace, maintaining the luxurious lifestyle of the Grisha and royalty.
The community of Grisha who live and train at the Little Palace. Divided into Corporalki (red kefta), Etherealki (blue kefta), and Materialki (purple kefta).

3.description: Elite guards who serve the Darkling directly. Wear black uniforms and are fanatically loyal to their master.

1.description: Brave sailors who pilot the sandskiffs across the Shadow Fold. Face constant danger from volcra attacks.
The other children who grew up at Keramzin orphanage alongside Alina and Mal. Many were later conscripted into the army.

4.description: Grisha who can manipulate fire and heat. Part of the Etherealki order and wear blue kefta.
Grisha who can manipulate air and wind. The most common type of Etherealki, wearing blue kefta.
Grisha who can manipulate water. The rarest of the Etherealki orders, also wearing blue kefta.

3.description: Grisha who can manipulate the human body - stopping hearts, healing, or controlling blood flow. Wear red kefta and are feared in combat.

4.description: Grisha who specialize in healing injuries and illnesses. A subset of Corporalki who wear red kefta.
Rare Grisha who can alter physical appearances. Genya is the only known Tailor at the Little Palace.
Grisha who work with chemicals, poisons, and other dangerous substances. Part of the Materialki order wearing purple kefta.
Grisha who work with solid materials like metal, stone, and wood. Create weapons and amplifiers for other Grisha.

1.description: Traders and business people whose livelihoods are severely impacted by the Shadow Fold cutting through Ravka's trade routes.

8.description: The aristocratic class of Ravka who live in luxury while the country suffers from war and the Shadow Fold.

3.description: Residents of Ravka's capital city where both the Grand Palace and Little Palace are located.

1.description: Military forces stationed at the town on the edge of the Shadow Fold, tasked with managing crossings and defense.

8.description: Religious figures in Ravka who begin to see Alina as a possible saint due to her light-summoning abilities.

16.description: Displaced people fleeing from the ongoing wars and the chaos caused by the expanding Shadow Fold.

6.description: A network of informants and agents who report to the Darkling throughout Ravka and beyond.

10.description: Academic researchers who maintain the extensive libraries at the Little Palace and study Grisha history and amplifiers.

18.description: Religious fanatics who worship Alina as 'Sankta Alina' and believe she will save Ravka from the Shadow Fold.

1.description: The captain of the skiff that carries Alina's unit across the Shadow Fold. An experienced veteran of many crossings.
A First Army officer who supervises the cartographers during the Fold crossing. Shows typical disdain for non-combat roles.
One of the children at Keramzin orphanage. A friend to both Alina and Mal during their childhood.
Another child from Keramzin orphanage. Part of Alina and Mal's childhood group.

3.description: A high-ranking First Army general who resents the Darkling's influence over military matters.

16.description: A First Army commander who leads forces against the Darkling's expansion of the Shadow Fold.

4.description: A young Inferni at the Little Palace. Nervous and eager to prove himself among the other Grisha.
An experienced Heartrender who helps train the younger Corporalki at the Little Palace.
A skilled Squaller who often works alongside Zoya. Less hostile than Zoya but still cool toward Alina.
A young Squaller who looks up to Zoya and mimics her dismissive attitude toward Alina.
A confident young Heartrender who is popular among the other Grisha at the Little Palace.
An eccentric Inferni who keeps unusual pets and has a reputation for unpredictable behavior.

12.description: A crew member aboard Sturmhond's ship. Skilled sailor and loyal to the captain.
Another member of Sturmhond's crew. Experienced in both sailing and combat.

8.description: A wealthy noble at the Ravkan court who seeks to curry favor with the royal family and the Darkling.
A young and somewhat foolish nobleman who is fascinated by Grisha powers and eager to ingratiate himself with Alina.

18.description: The spare prince of Ravka who has been living as the privateer Sturmhond. Intelligent, charismatic, and politically savvy.

4.description: A Durast who works in the workshops of the Little Palace, creating weapons and tools for the Grisha.
An Alkemi who specializes in creating poisons and other dangerous chemical compounds at the Little Palace.
An elderly Durast who teaches the younger Materialki and has vast knowledge of amplifier creation.
A kind Healer who works in the infirmary at the Little Palace, tending to injured Grisha and students.

18.description: A former Grisha who joined Alina's resistance movement after becoming disillusioned with the Darkling.
A young boy who becomes devoted to Alina and serves as a messenger in her underground movement.

16.description: A First Army captain who leads troops in the fight against the Darkling's forces after the Fold expansion.

relationships.General Zlatan: Reports to through chain of command

18.description: A priest who serves under the Apparat and helps spread the word of Alina as a saint among the people.
A nun who tends to refugees and spreads the Apparat's religious message about Alina being a saint.

1.description: A First Army officer stationed at Kribirsk who oversees the organization of Fold crossings.

10.description: A scholar at the Little Palace who specializes in ancient Grisha history and the study of amplifiers.

4.description: A servant at the Little Palace who is assigned to help Alina adjust to her new life and luxury.

12.description: A crew member on Sturmhond's ship who specializes in maintaining the vessel's unusual flying capabilities.

16.description: A young First Army soldier who joins Alina's cause after witnessing the destruction caused by the expanded Shadow Fold.

8.description: The crown prince of Ravka, heir to the throne. More interested in parties and luxury than governing.

recaps.1: Alina Starkov, a sickly mapmaker in the First Army, prepares to cross the dangerous Shadow Fold with her childhood friend Mal Oretsev. The Shadow Fold is a swath of darkness filled with monsters called volcra that divides Ravka. Alina reflects on her childhood at Keramzin orphanage and her deep friendship with Mal.
recaps.2: The skiff carrying Alina's unit is attacked by volcra in the Shadow Fold. When Mal is gravely injured, Alina's desperation triggers a burst of brilliant light that drives away the creatures. The mysterious Darkling, leader of the Grisha, arrives and recognizes Alina as the legendary Sun Summoner.
recaps.3: The Darkling takes Alina to Os Alta, the capital, while she struggles to understand her new powers. She is separated from Mal and brought to the opulent Little Palace where the Grisha live and train. The Darkling explains that she may be powerful enough to destroy the Shadow Fold.
recaps.4: Alina is given luxurious quarters at the Little Palace and meets other Grisha, including the hostile Zoya and the friendly Marie and Nadia. Genya, a beautiful Grisha Tailor, befriends her and improves her appearance. Alina begins to feel overwhelmed by the attention and expectations placed upon her.
recaps.5: Alina begins training with the harsh instructor Baghra, who shows no patience for her struggles to control her power. She also trains in combat with Botkin and learns about Grisha politics from Genya. The Darkling maintains a mysterious but compelling presence in her life.
recaps.6: Alina's training intensifies as Baghra pushes her harder. She begins to make progress with her light-summoning abilities but still struggles with consistency. The other Grisha watch her with a mixture of awe and resentment, particularly Zoya who becomes increasingly hostile.
recaps.7: As Alina grows stronger, she becomes more integrated into Little Palace life but feels increasingly isolated from her past. She longs to see Mal but is told he is on assignment. The Darkling becomes more attentive, and Alina finds herself drawn to him despite her reservations.
recaps.8: Alina is presented at court to the King and Queen of Ravka, where she demonstrates her powers. The vain Queen is more interested in Genya's beauty treatments than Alina's abilities. The Apparat, the King's priest, sees religious potential in Alina's power. Political intrigue swirls around her growing reputation.
recaps.9: Alina's fame spreads throughout Ravka as news of the Sun Summoner reaches the people. She performs public demonstrations of her power, bringing hope to the war-torn nation. However, she feels increasingly like a political tool rather than a person, and her desire to see Mal grows stronger.
recaps.10: Baghra reveals shocking truths about the Darkling's past and his true intentions. She warns Alina that the Darkling plans to use her power for his own dark purposes and that she must flee immediately. Alina learns about Morozova's amplifiers and their connection to the Darkling's centuries-long plan.
recaps.11: Following Baghra's warning, Alina escapes from the Little Palace disguised as a servant. She flees into the countryside, determined to find Mal and warn him about the Darkling's true nature. Her journey is dangerous as she must avoid both the Darkling's agents and enemy forces.
recaps.12: Alina reunites with Mal, and they flee together across Ravka while being pursued by the Darkling's forces. They seek passage across the True Sea but are betrayed and captured. Just as they face execution, they are rescued by the charismatic privateer captain Sturmhond and his crew.
recaps.13: Aboard Sturmhond's ship, Alina and Mal meet Tolya and Tamar, twin Grisha warriors who serve the privateer. Alina learns that Sturmhond knows her true identity and offers to help her find Morozova's amplifiers. She must decide whether to trust this mysterious captain with her secrets.
recaps.14: The group travels to hunt for the legendary Stag, one of Morozova's amplifiers that could greatly enhance Alina's power. They face dangers in the wilderness while being pursued by the Darkling's forces. Alina struggles with the moral implications of killing the magical creature for its power.
recaps.15: They successfully track and find Morozova's Stag in the forest. However, their triumph is short-lived as the Darkling arrives with his forces, having anticipated their destination. A confrontation ensues over who will claim the amplifier, with Alina caught between her desire for power and her conscience.
recaps.16: The Darkling kills the Stag and forces its antler collar around Alina's neck, binding her power to his will. He reveals his true plan to expand the Shadow Fold and use it as a weapon against Ravka's enemies. Alina realizes she has become a prisoner despite her enhanced abilities.
recaps.17: Under the Darkling's control, Alina is forced to demonstrate the expanded Shadow Fold's destructive power by obliterating an enemy stronghold. Hundreds die in the darkness as the Fold consumes everything in its path. Alina is horrified by her unwilling participation in this massacre.
recaps.18: Sturmhond reveals his true identity as Prince Nikolai Lantsov of Ravka, adding a new political dimension to their alliance. Meanwhile, Alina struggles to break free from the Darkling's control over her power through the amplifier. The Apparat's religious movement grows stronger as people view Alina as a saint.
recaps.19: Alina discovers a way to fight back against the Darkling's control by drawing on her connection to the Stag's spirit and her own inner strength. She begins to reclaim her power while planning her resistance against the Darkling. Mal supports her despite the personal cost.
recaps.20: The resistance against the Darkling gains momentum as Alina masters her abilities and breaks free from his control. She reunites with Genya and other allies who have turned against the Darkling after learning of his true nature. A plan forms to stop him from using the Shadow Fold as a weapon.
recaps.21: Alina leads an assault on the Shadow Fold itself, attempting to destroy it and end the Darkling's power source. The battle is fierce as the Darkling commands volcra and his remaining followers. Alina must push her abilities to their limit while her friends fight for their lives.
recaps.22: In the climactic confrontation, Alina faces the Darkling in direct combat within the Shadow Fold. She realizes that destroying him may require sacrificing her own power. The battle threatens to consume everyone as light and darkness clash in an epic struggle.
recaps.23: Alina makes the ultimate sacrifice, using all her power to destroy the Shadow Fold and defeat the Darkling, but loses her abilities in the process. She and Mal escape to start a new life together, free from the burdens of power and politics. Ravka begins to heal as the Fold disappears and hope returns to the land.
